body_content.explanation: to move or climb quickly but with difficulty, often using your hands to help you:
examples: She scrambled up the steep hillside and over the rocks.
He scrambled into his clothes (= put them on quickly) and raced to get help.
As the burning plane landed, the terrified passengers scrambled for the door (= tried to reach the door quickly).

body_content.explanation: to compete with other people for something there is very little of:
examples: People are scrambling to buy property before prices rise even further.

body_content.explanation: (of a quarterback in American football) to run quickly with the ball to avoid an opponent who has broken through the line of players that protects them:
examples: The quarterback saw the defender coming and scrambled to his right for six yards.

body_content.explanation: to put things such as words or letters in the wrong order so that they do not make sense:
examples: He had a habit of scrambling his words when excited.

body_content.explanation: to mix food as it is being fried, especially eggs or tofu (= a soft, pale food that has very little flavour but is high in protein, made from the seed of the soya plant):
examples: I’m sure this dish would be just as delicious if you scrambled the eggs first.
You can use any kind of tofu when scrambling it.

body_content.explanation: to change a radio or phone signal so that it can only be understood using a special device
to (cause a plane to) take off very quickly:
examples: A helicopter was scrambled within minutes of the news.

body_content.explanation: a climb that is difficult so that you have to use your hands to help you:
examples: It was a real scramble to the top of the hillside.
As soon as the plane landed there was a mad/wild scramble to get out.

body_content.explanation: a hurried attempt to get something:
examples: After the death of the dictator there was an unseemly scramble for power among the generals.
We're planning a scramble through the forest next weekend.

body_content.explanation: a dish of food that is mixed as it is being fried, especially eggs or tofu (= a soft, pale food that has very little flavour but is high in protein, made from the seed of the soya plant):
examples: tofu scramble with mushrooms and spinach
